title: Arches National Park
summary: Arches National Park is a national park in eastern Utah, United States. The park is adjacent to the Colorado River, 4 miles (6Â km) north of Moab, Utah. More than 2,000 natural sandstone arches are located in the park, including the well-known Delicate Arch, as well as a variety of unique geological resources and formations. The park contains the highest density of natural arches in the world.[3][4]
